Re: Offer of Employment with VitalPet.

${object.offer_send_date}

${object.partner_name} ${object.last_name}

Dear ${object.partner_name},

VitalPet, is pleased to offer you a full time position at VitalPet - ${object.company_id.name} as ${object.job_id.name}, on the terms set forth in this letter agreement, upon your acceptance by execution of a counterpart copy of this letter where indicated below. Your start date will be ______________

1. Reporting: Duties and Responsibilities. In this position you will report directly to ${object.user_id.name or ''}.Your specific duties and responsibilities will be determined by your supervisor. The Company may change your position, duties and responsibilities from time to time as it deems necessary.

2. Compensation. Your hourly wage will be ${object.salary_proposed} payable every two weeks, subject to standard payroll deductions and withholdings. If you are a full time hourly team member (a Team Member who was hired to fill a full time position and consistently works an average of 35 hours or more per week depending upon the business volume and needs) you are eligible for overtime pay for any time worked over forty hours in a week. Overtime pay will be equal to 1.5 times your hourly pay rate. The Company may modify your compensation as it deems necessary upon notice to you.

3. Introductory Period of Employment. Your first ninety (90) days of employment will be considered an introductory period of employment, during which both you and the Company will assess your attitude, skills, interest and abilities. At or near the conclusion of the ninety day period the Company will conduct a job performance evaluation.

4. Benefits. Pursuant to the terms, conditions and limitations of the handbook and benefits plans document, as a full time hourly team member you will be eligible for the following standard company benefits: Medical, Dental, and Vision plan, Life Benefits and $20,000 of term life insurance and accidental death and dismemberment coverage at no cost, AFLAC Coverage, and various Assistance Programs. As a VitalPet Team Member, you will be also eligible for Team Member Discounts.

% if object.contract_type_id.name == "Full Time Employee":

5. Paid Time Off (PTO). You are eligible to accrue up to 40 hours of PTO during the first year of employment. Accrual begins at the start of employment and is based on hours worked; however, PTO may not be taken until the introductory period has passed.

6. At-Will Employment. Both during the introductory period and thereafter, your employment with the Company is considered to be “at will.” This means that you are free to resign at any time and for any reason, and the Company is free to terminate your employment at any time, with or without cause or advance notice. Any statements or representations to the contrary (and, indeed, any statements contradicting any provision in this letter) is ineffective.

7. Authorization to Work. Because of Federal legal requirements, this offer of employment is subject to satisfactory proof of your right to work in the United States. If you have any questions about this requirement, which applies to U.S. citizens and non-U.S. citizens alike, please let your supervisor know.

8. Term of Offer. This offer is contingent upon successful completion of a background and drug screening, along with reference check. A second email from your hiring manager will follow this offer with instructions on how to complete this process using Driven Hire, our background check and drug screening provider.

This offer will remain open until ${object.offer_expiration_date}.If you decide to accept our offer, and we hope that you will, please print, sign and return this letter to your VitalPet contact. Upon submission, this letter will become our binding agreement and will form the complete and exclusive statement of your employment agreement with the Company. The employment terms in this letter supersede any other agreements or promises made to you by anyone, whether oral or written.

9. Confidentiality. All VitalPet’s records are confidential and legal property, and they are protected by the Private Act. Once onboard the new hire must commit to don’t share any type of information with unapproved personnel, regarding client/patient, finances, team members, and/or other type of private records. The new team member may be required to sign a non-disclosure agreement as a condition of employment.
